other_tests.findings: pH was 7.30, and base excess was -8
other_tests.changes_over_time: The metabolic acidosis partially resolved by the end of the procedure at 720 min.

other_tests.findings: Initial analysis showed pH 7.43, lactate 1.45 mM, base excess 1.6 mM; subsequent analysis showed pH 7.28, lactate 6.99 mM, base excess -5.1 mM; further increase with pH 7.26, lactate 8.2 mM, base excess -6.9 mM.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Progressive worsening of metabolic acidosis was observed despite fluid administration.

other_tests.findings: Freedom from pain was obtained with 0.6 ml isobaric bupivacaine.
other_tests.changes_over_time: After administration of alcohol neurolysis, no allodynia or hyperalgesia were noted, and pruritus and residual steady burning pain remained at VAS score 2 cm.

other_tests.findings: Freedom from pain was obtained with 0.3 ml isobaric bupivacaine.
other_tests.changes_over_time: After alcohol neurolysis, complete pain relief was reported after 10 months.

other_tests.findings: Freedom from pain was obtained with 0.3 ml isobaric bupivacaine.
other_tests.changes_over_time: No reports of side effects, motor deficits, or pain were noted, and after 10 months patient was completely free of pain.

other_tests.findings: Freedom from pain was obtained with 0.3 ml isobaric bupivacaine.
other_tests.changes_over_time: The patient reported burning pain VAS score of 5 cm after the procedure but no shooting pain.

other_tests.findings: Freedom from pain was obtained with 0.3 ml isobaric bupivacaine.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Patient has been poorly responsive and continues to experience pain with a VAS score of 8 cm.

other_tests.findings: Catalase activity was markedly decreased at 28 U/g hemoglobin.
